instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2855: What is 820-2855? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..

threads.title: MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: Hi, I'm learning how to repair the macbooks, I'm working on a macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, card <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A, the cold machine starts normally, at some point, has video artefacts, and then 3 beeps, I don't seem to recognise the twig, I don't know how to do it, because

threads.title: MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Looks like RAM issue.
You can try to reflow all DDR chips, gently tapping each one, to ensure good solders.
Reballing should be the best option.

Keep in mind, broken solders/traces under CPU can cause this symptom too.

threads.title: MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: I thought the can, too, but the machine starts at the beginning is all normal, with another machine didn't read the twine from the beginning and he didn't go to video, but He starts, after something warm up, the problems started

threads.title: MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message: This is what I get, I don't know if I dedicate myself to cpu or to ram.[ATTACH type="full"]59565[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59565[/ATTACH]

threads.title: MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2855</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A
threads.message:
You can only try to reflow/reball RAM chips.
Unless you have necessary tools and skills to reball/change CPU.
However, first step is to go for RAM...
